On Mon, 23 Jun 2003, spam_if_you_want_to wrote:

> I am currently developing a program and using JUnit for testing.  I
> would like to release my program under the GPL license.  The GPL is
> not compatible with JUnit's CPL license, but the Free Software
> Foundation have told me that I can insert an exception into my GPL to
> allow linking against CPLed libraries.  However, they warned me that I
> might still be violating the CPL if I do this.

You need to get clear in your head who is licensing what.

If you release code including JUnit code, then the JUnit license
applies to the JUnit code and your license applies to your own code.
You cannot change the terms of the JUnit license.  You have no right
to do so.

> So, can I link my GPLed program against JUnit?  If not I will have to
> strip out all the tests before I release.

After a quick review of the JUnit license, I would say that you can
include the code but must identify it as JUnit code and state that that
part of the software is released under the JUnit license, which you
should supply a copy of.
